page.title: 07ALTHAM PUMPING STATION
page.content: The pumping station was opened in 1908. It supplies fresh water to the Hyndburn and Burnley areas. Betsy, the steam engine, pumped water from 4 deep bore holes. The water was then purified. New machinery was installed in 1955 and the station was re-opened in 1957. The station operates throughout the year and employs 10 men, of whom 9 work around the district. The former corn mill is now a self- sufficient housing cooperative. A new industrial estate has been built with the help of a grant from the E.E.C. Businesses include: Wholesale toiletry and medicines Manufacture of salt gritting machines Graphic arts Textile weaving Building of road tankers Horse shoe nail making.
